intro: Candollea alsinoides, commonly known as the hairy false flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Candollea alsinoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to withstand drought conditions.
